ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Generally this is a great course. You learn a lot and the workload isn't overwhelming, the exams are reasonable and the material is interesting. I would recommend it to another student.
Yes, would recommend Pharm 528 to anyone interested in cell signaling.
Yes I would highly recommend the course to anyone who is conducting research in the cells signaling field, as well as a supplement to any research in any area.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The material learned is definitely useful for my work, as I work in a signal transduction lab. I do think about some of these pathways on a daily basis, but knowing something about the others helps give me perspective on new things to think about. I don't think this course will contribute a whole ton to my research, but it might contribute to the papers I choose to read or my understanding of them, which is certainly useful.
It great enhances my background in cell signaling, as well as bring together important insights from great experts in their fields.
